instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan max speed
threads.message:
Hello,
I have this board that had short to ground on CB300 due to a liquid spill on that side. It was isolated liquid damage on that side of the board.
After repairing that the left fan (looking from top) now starts at max speed and stays there. The other fan is not even on.

I can control both fans with software.
I tried a known good top case with keyboard, trackpad, fans etc..

HWSensors shows all standard except airport proximity 129 degrees.

Any idea what to check?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan max speed
threads.message:
A little update that might help. 

Heating the SMC area seems to make the fan stop. I reflowed the SMC and it looked like it fixed the issue. However, after a few hours, I left it to sleep. While asleep the fan started on its own and now the issue is back again.

I am pretty sure there is no corrosion or crap under, I also don't have another 00239, I do have an 00850 but probably the SMC is different.
Is it worth ordering a donor for the SMC or it's unlikely that replacing it will fix the issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan max speed
threads.message: Check traces betweenQ6050, <RESISTOR>R6051</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R6055</RESISTOR>, SMC and friends. pay attention corrosion as traces enter probe points.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> left fan max speed
threads.message:
Liquid spill affected more things.
If you've got that reaction reflowing SMC, you may need to reball it.
But could be another thing located close to heated area.
